speakerBioSummary.text:
• Kate Fagan is a sought-after speaker on athlete mental health, LGBT issues within sports, and the variables facing female athletes.
  • She is an Emmy-award winning journalist and the No. 1 New York Times bestselling author of WHAT MADE MADDY RUN, as well as the coming-of-age memoir THE REAPPEARING ACT. Her third book, ALL THE COLORS CAME OUT, tells an unforgettable story about basketball and the enduring bonds between a father and daughter.
  • She currently writes for Sports Illustrated, and previously spent seven years as a columnist and feature writer for espnW, ESPN.com and ESPN The Magazine.
  • She was also a regular panelist on ESPN's "Around the Horn" and host of "Outside the Lines."

speakerBiography.text:
Kate Fagan is an Emmy-award winning journalist and the No. 1 New York Times bestselling author of WHAT MADE MADDY RUN, as well as the coming-of-age memoir THE REAPPEARING ACT. Her third book, ALL THE COLORS CAME OUT, will be released in May 2021 from Little, Brown. She currently writes for Sports Illustrated, and previously spent seven years as a columnist and feature writer for espnW, ESPN.com and ESPN The Magazine.

She was also a regular panelist on ESPN's "Around the Horn" and host of "Outside the Lines." She lives in Charleston, South Carolina with her wife, Kathryn Budig, and their two dogs. Together host the podcast “Free Cookies,” which blends wellness, food, and humor and she was named a 2018 Webby finalist for "Best Sports Podcast."

speakerNameSubheading.text: #1 New York Times Bestselling Author, Writer, & Host of the Free Cookies Podcast

speakerReview.text: Kate was truly sensational, and the reviews I have been getting from our students, coaches and staff have been through the roof.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW

speakerReview.text: Kate is fantastic in every way. Better and more meaningful than we could have hoped for. Very thankful for her and her willingness to come to Nashville.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW

speakerReview.text: I can’t say enough good things about Kate. She struck the perfect tone for this sensitive topic, and was very important to the success of this event.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW

speakerReview.text: I can't say enough amazing things about Kate's visit and the impact it had on our students. Kate was warm and personable, and her parent presentation was equally as meaningful.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW

speakerReview.text: Everything went really well. I don't think anything could have gone better! Student-athletes are already asking if she can come back again next year.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW

speakerReview.text: Kate was absolutely amazing. She worked out so well for our Women’s Retreat, and all of our ladies loved her.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW

speakerReview.text: Kate was amazing (not surprisingly)! I am getting tons of feedback from our employees about all the different ways they are relating to her story.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW
